alert.note: Alert for Fulton; Hamilton; Herkimer; Warren (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 02 at 10:49PM EST until February 02 at 11:45PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albany has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Hamilton County in eastern New York... Northwestern Warren County in east central New York... Northwestern Fulton County in eastern New York... Herkimer County in eastern New York... * Until 1145 PM EST. * At 1047 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located near Newport, or 10 miles north of Little Falls, moving east-southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts greater than 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes Interstate 90 between exits 29A and 30. Locations impacted include... Ilion, Herkimer, Little Falls, Indian Lake, Speculator, Mohawk, Frankfort, Dolgeville, Ohio, West Winfield, Lake Pleasant, Wells, Newport, Stratford, Middleville, Poland, Cold Brook, Jordanville, Moffitt Beach Campground and Lewey Lake Campground. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents.
